definition: surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead

sentences.english: The first printed books were made by putting ink on a wooden block and holding the paper against it.
sentences.chinese: 第一本印刷书是用纸紧贴涂有墨汁的木版制成的。

sentences.english: I remember. You had black ink on your hand.
sentences.chinese: 我记起来了，你的手上有黑墨汁。

sentences.english: This means the ink goes directly onto the paper.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，墨汁直接就被印在了纸上。

sentences.english: In case of danger, it will eject ink out, then decamp.
sentences.chinese: 假若遇到危险，它会喷出墨汁出来，然后逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: Delt once again by myself. Plenty of ink still there.
sentences.chinese: 倒入水池，亲自重新收拾，墨汁还是很多。

sentences.english: He says he likes the cleanliness of ink drawing on paper.
sentences.chinese: 他说他非常喜欢墨汁画在纸上的那种洁净的感觉。

sentences.english: They can't put me in jail for having ink on my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他们不能因为我手上有墨汁就把我关进监狱。

sentences.english: He knocked over a bottle of ink and ruined my painting.
sentences.chinese: 他打翻了一瓶墨汁，把我的画给毁了。

sentences.english: Transparant slices and tissue slices after ink injection.
sentences.chinese: 墨汁灌注透明及组织学切片观察。

definition: fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
red ink paste used for seal
cinnabar/mercuric sulfide HgS/also written 硃砂|朱砂[zhu1 sha1]
paste/also written 漿糊|浆糊[jiang4 hu5]/Taiwan pr. [jiang4 hu2]
nib/pen point/the tip of a writing brush or pencil
